div.l: Ther durstdustdurst no white hondghonghond oppon̄ him legg͗e
That he ne swore a non̄ he shuld abegg͗e
A Thefe he was for soth of corn̄ ⁊and mele
And that a sly and vsant for to stele
His name was I hoot denus Symkyn̄
A wyfe he had I com of nobil kyn̄
The Person̄ of the Town̄ her fadir was
With her he ȝaf ful many a pann̄ of bras
For that Symkyn̄ shuld in his blode aly
She was fosterid in a Nonnery
For Symkyn̄ wold no wyfe as he seid
But she were wele I norisshid and a maid
~To saue his astate of yemanry The marginal tilde may notice the unrhymed line
A ful feir͗e sight was oppon hem to
An holy day beforn̄ her wold he go
With his tippet I bound about his hede
And she cam aftir in agite of rede
And Symkyn̄ had hosyn̄ of the same
Ther͗e durst no white clepe her but dame
Was non̄ so hardy that went be the wey
That with her͗e onys durst rage or pley
But yf he wold be sleyn̄ of Symkyn̄
With pavade knyfe or Bodekyn̄
For Ielouse folk ben̄ perlouse evir mo
Algatis they woldyn̄ her vivis wendyn̄ so
And eke also for she was som̄ dele smotirlich
She was as deyn̄ as watir in a dich
And ful of hocour͗e and of bismare
Her thoght a lady shuld her spare
What for her kynrede and her noryte
That she had lernyd in the Nonnere
A doghter had they be twix hem to
Of xx ȝere age with outyn̄ mo
Saveing a Child þat was half ȝeer age
In Cradil it lay and was a propir͗e page
This wench thik and wele growyn̄ was
With Camoys nose and yȝen grey as glas
